mods:mods.mods:abstract: Acknowledges John Jay's letter of 19 June giving him permission to return to the United States; will return to United States in October. Gives details of transaction with Dutch bankers concerning funds for foreign officers and captives. Indecisive Russo-Swedish naval engagement in Baltic. Revolution in Liege bishopric. Paris quiet except for differences between French and Swiss guards. Regime's financial difficulties and shortage of bread may furnish "leaven" for new uprisings. Necker helpless in National Assembly. Assembly not yet considering plan for constitution, but leading members have such a plan fairly well formulated--their plan provides for a hereditary monarch, elected legislature, and "senate" with the powers of a council of revision. Judicial system also to be revised under this plan, as would be local and provincial governments. However, any plan must face considerable modification at the hands of the Assembly. Aristocratic party has been strengthened in the body as has the group hoping to put the Duke d'Orleans on the throne. Has investigated rumors that France contemplated selling West Indian possessions to Britain. Such rumors without foundation, although the Orleans faction may have been up to something of this sort. Emancipation of these islands, however, is under consideration by some members of the Assembly.
